bug.author: sharifza
bug.summary: Number of batches as a function of number of entities [RGCN]
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Potential Bug</denchmark-h>
I might be missing out something but to me this line looks a bit strange:
dgl/examples/pytorch/rgcn/utils.py
Line 169 in 17b60e1
n_batch = (num_entity + batch_size - 1) // batch_size
It seems like number of batches is computed by dividing number of entities (nodes) to batch size. Shouldn't that be (test_size + batch_size - 1) // batch_size instead ? <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Instead of
dgl/examples/pytorch/rgcn/utils.py
Line 198 in 17b60e1
ranks_s = perturb_and_get_rank(embedding, w, o, r, s, num_entity, eval_bz)
and
dgl/examples/pytorch/rgcn/utils.py
Line 200 in 17b60e1
ranks_o = perturb_and_get_rank(embedding, w, s, r, o, num_entity, eval_bz)
we should have ranks_s = perturb_and_get_rank(embedding, w, o, r, s, test_triplets.shape[0], eval_bz) and ranks_o = perturb_and_get_rank(embedding, w, s, r, o, test_triplets.shape[0], eval_bz) I can do a pull request if someone confirms this...

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sharifza>@sharifza</denchmark-link> I think you are right. It should not be number of entities. It should be number of triplets in the test. Please open a PR.
Thanks for looking at it @ylfdq1118, please take a look at the PR.
